data.title: Dallas County PFL
data.meta_description: Official Web Site of Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources
data.text:
Managers: Earle Williams Sr. and Shakenyia Pullom

Address and Telephone:

800 County Road 6

Sardis, AL 36775

334-267-9625

Lake Information:

100 acre lake

Contour maps (PDF 204 KB)

Open Interactive lake contour map To view the maps, check the “Fishing” box. Then click the plus icon to expand the choices. Check “Lake Contours” and “Lake Depths” and the contour maps will appear.

Fish Species:

Largemouth bass, bluegill, redear sunfish, channel catfish, and crappie.

Daily Creel Limit:

Bream ----------50

Catfish ----------6

Crappie ---------30

Striped Bass ----2

Bass--------------2 (over 18")

(unlimited bass under 18")

Location:

Dallas County Lake is located 11 miles south of Selma off Alabama Highway 41 in Sardis, Alabama. From Selma take Ala. Hwy 41 south for 11 miles, then right on County Road 6 to Dallas County Lake.

Hours of Operation:

Open sunrise to sunset:

February 1 - June 30: Open six days each week. Closed Mondays.

July 1 - November 26, 2023: Closed Mondays & Tuesdays.

November 27, 2023 through January 31, 2024 Closed

Will be open for the July 4, 2023 holiday

Facilities:

Boat ramp

Fishing pier ** ADA Compliant **

Restrooms

Concessions (Bait, tackle, and snacks) ** ADA Compliant **

Licenses and Permits:

Normal Fishing License Requirements Apply to Anglers Age 16 or Older*

Daily Fishing Permit Required in Addition to License for Anglers Age 12 and Older $3.00

Boat Rental Permit (Daily fishing permit also required) $5.00

Launch Permit for Personal Boat (Daily fishing permit also required) $3.00

This information is subject to change without notice. Additional information and rules about the lakes are available from the lake manager, the Alabama Fisheries Section at (334) 242-3471, or the appropriate District Fisheries Office.
